title: Masculine Wholeness
subtitle: Beyond the caricature—becoming a complete man
description: Explore the full spectrum of healthy masculinity. This course helps men integrate all four masculine archetypes, heal father wounds, reclaim healthy aggression, and develop the emotional depth that makes strong leadership possible.

modules.title: Beyond Toxic and Soft
modules.description: What healthy masculinity actually looks like

modules.title: The Four Masculine Archetypes
modules.description: King, Warrior, Magician, Lover—and their shadows

modules.title: Healing Father Wounds
modules.description: Working with what your father couldn't give

modules.title: Reclaiming Your Aggression
modules.description: Healthy anger, boundaries, and protective power

modules.title: Purpose and Mission
modules.description: Finding what you're here to do

whatYouLearn: Understand the difference between healthy and unhealthy masculinity
Work with the four masculine archetypes and their shadows
Process father wounds and absent father patterns
Reclaim healthy aggression without becoming harmful
Show up more fully in intimate relationships
requirements: Willingness to examine conditioning around manhood
Some prior inner work helpful but not required

questions.question: What is 'toxic masculinity' most accurately describing?
options: Distorted expressions of masculine energy that harm self and others

questions.question: What are the four masculine archetypes in Jungian/Moore-Gillette framework?
What is the shadow of the King archetype?
How do unhealed father wounds typically manifest?
options: Difficulties with authority, self-worth, or knowing what you want
Only in relationships with older men

questions.question: What is healthy aggression?
options: Life force energy used for protection, boundaries, and pursuing goals

questions.question: Why is emotional depth important for masculine development?
options: It isn't - men shouldn't be emotional
It enables better decisions, deeper relationships, and genuine strength

questions.question: What does 'masculine presence' mean in relationship context?
options: Fully showing up, being grounded, and holding space without reactivity
